text:
Comment 
Even as the first of the five-phase elections having started in Bihar on 12 October, BJP ’s star campaigner Shanawaz Hussain declared the party’s lawmaker from Gaya, Prem Kumar to be will be the NDA ’s chief ministerial (CM) candidate if NDA comes to power in Bihar . 
The statement is against the party’s tradition, which doesn’t announce its CM candidate in advance. Hussain made the announcement at the party’s campaign meeting in Gaya. 
“I request you to return your MLA Prem Kumar again with a majority. He will be the NDA ’s CM candidate,” said Hussain, a senior leader said. 
The BJP , trying to add Bihar to its kitty, has not yet announced a CM candidate. The party has only been campaigning in the state on the plank of development of PM Narendra Modi . 
It may be noted that during Jharkhand, Haryana and Maharashtra polls too the CM candidate was announced only after the results were announced . 
Kumar, a six-time MLA from Gaya, was propped by his supporters for the top job on social networking sites. He is regarded as the BJP ’s face for the EBCs, which form a chunk of voters in Bihar . 
Kumar’s candidature can dovetail with Modi ’s development plank. But according to reports, competitors for the top post included a few other key leaders, including former deputy chief minister Sushil Kumar Modi .
